title: Bug 102516 JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand
description: Bug 102516 JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand. The JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query has a tree control that lists the tables and columns in the data source. Currently, on the iSeries platform using the JTOpen JDBC drivers, this tree control shows every schema (aka catalog) on the system, which can be several hundred tables. The code from CVS dated 6/30/05 includes a schema filter, but there is still a warning message during the page load since the tree is being populated all at once. It would be ideal if the load of the tree can be deferred until the user expands the tree or applies a filter.
OB: On the iSeries platform using the JTOpen JDBC drivers, the tree control in the JDBC Data Set Editor page shows every schema (aka catalog) on the system, which includes several hundred tables. Despite having a schema filter, there is still a warning message during the page load because the tree is being populated all at once.
EB: The load of the tree in the JDBC Data Set Editor should be deferred until the user expands the tree or applies a filter to improve performance and avoid the warning message during initial page load.
SR:
1. Open the JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query.
2. Observe the tree control that lists the tables and columns in the data source.
3. Notice that the tree is being populated all at once.
4. Expand the tree or apply a filter to observe performance improvement and avoid the warning message during the page load.
